laboratory_examinations.findings: Alpha streptococcus and neisseria were detected; three types of microbes (gram-positive cocci, gram-negative cocci, gram-negative rod) identified in gram-stained specimen.
Showed exacerbation of lung suppuration with parapneumonic effusion and increased gas formation; revealed a round mass in the consolidated right middle lobe enhanced equally to the pulmonary vessel.
Showed gram-positive cocci in the cavity and cavitary wall; bacteriologic culture and PCR for acid-fast bacillus were all negative.
